text.__SUMMARY__: Conus wilsi is a species of sea snail, a marine gastropod mollusk in the family Conidae, the cone snails and their allies.Like all species within the genus Conus, these snails are predatory and venomous. They are capable of "stinging" humans, therefore live ones should be handled carefully or not at all.
text.Description: The size of the shell attains 30 mm.
text.Distribution: This species occurs in the Red Sea.
text.References:
Delsaerdt, A. 1998. Conus wilsi a new species from the Red Sea. Gloria Maris 36(4):69-72, 4 figs.
Puillandre, N.; Duda, T.F.; Meyer, C.; Olivera, B.M.; Bouchet, P. (2015). "One, four or 100 genera? A new classification of the cone snails". Journal of Molluscan Studies. 81: 1–23. doi:10.1093/mollus/eyu055. PMC 4541476.
